intro: Myosotis drabifolia, commonly known as the dwarf forget-me-not, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically reaches a height of only a few centimeters, with narrow, hairy leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Myosotis drabifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens with suitable conditions.
